About

More About Me

QI Physicist | Programming Enthusiast | Inner Explorer

Hallo! | नमस्ते!

Challenge, drudgery, and bliss - I think these three words describe the life I have lived. Every new opportunity begins with a challenge, when we explore new things, realize our potential and turn it into reality. But after that challenging phase, lies a lot of drudgery. The phase when we make things perfect. It’s the phase where we give the maximum of efforts and achieve the least of results. The final phase is pure bliss.

I was in Ahmedabad, working as a Scientist at Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO). I consider that time as my formative years. There were challenging problems to be solved, and a lot of drudgery to reach there. ISRO taught me many lessons, the most important of which was to be specific about your research objectives and pursue them diligently. I left ISRO in 2018 to pursue further studies, and this time I knew I wanted to explore the field of Quantum information and computing.

With that in mind, I joined University of Cologne as a BCGS scholar for Masters in Physics (Hons.). At present, I am working in the research group of Prof. Tommasso Calarco at Jülich Forschungzentrum, Germany. We are exploring time evolution of large, sparse quantum states.

I've Got Some skills.

  • Advanced

Download My CV

Professional Research Experience

September 2012 - August 2016

Astrosat CZTI Software Pipeline

Scientist | Indian Space Research Organization

Developed Level-2 data reduction pipeline for Cadmium Zinc Telluride Imager (CZTI) onboard Astrosat.

2017

Autonomous Spacecraft Navigation

R&D Focal person | Indian Space Research Organization

Developed algorithm to estimate and recursively correct spacecraft state for deep-space missions using X-ray Pulsar data.

2014

Mars Orbiter Mission(MOM)

Scientist | Indian Space Research Organization

Carried out orbital simulation for Martian phase of MOM. Developed data processing software for Methane Sensor for Mars (MSM).

2015 - 2017

Radiometric Correction

Scientist | Indian Space Research Organization

Radiometric calibration of Cartosat-2S satellites by modelling Light Transfer Characteristics (LTC).

Academic Research Experience

January 2012 - May 2012

Simulation of Young Embdded Clusters

Advisor: Dr. Sarita Vig

Simulated young embedded clusters based on models from Vig et al. (2007).

July 2011 - August 2011

Study and Analysis of Anomalous X-ray Pulsars

Advisor: Dr. Sachindra Naik

Carried out Analysis of 1E 1841-045 using Suzaku data.

June 2010 - July 2010

Image Fusion

Advisor: Dr. Shefali Agarwal

Image fusion of high spatial resolution Panchromatic Image and low resolution colored image using Daubechies Wavelet transform.

Journal

Selected Articles

This is a collection of some of the articles which I have written over the years. I am trying to compile them here.

4 January, 2020

Judy Arrays: Unbounded Associative Arrays.

Once upon a time, in a secluded place, far from the noise of the world, I was trying to classicaly simulate time evolution quantum operators. The Matrix realization of the operator depends upon the size of the quantum system. Unfortunately, Quantum race of the 21st Century among the Tech Giants have increased the system size to be more than 100 qubits. For us, this meant a Data Type that can store around 2100 values. Hence, the search led to Judy Arrays.

Julia Judy
28 February, 2020

Lost in Math?

Sometimes we do random things, and this book was read because one semester I found myself comparatively free (वेल्ला), that I decided to take Philosophy for Physics course. Far from the equations, the course felt like a breath of fresh air.

Physics Particle Physics Popular Science

The Passage of Time.

My 17-key Kalimba hardly covers two octaves, but gosh it's not an easy instrument. Unlike keyboard, I find that it is difficult to maintain Tempo with Kalimba. Perhaps, that's my inexperience speaking. I'll update you once I am Fluent in this skill. It helps me calm my mind.

Kalimba An Unusual Instrument

Julia, I believe, is the language that is going to define scientific computing. The language has a lot to offer, and unlike other high level languages, Julia does not try to make things simpler more than they should be. With my limited experience, I have only realized that this is the language that fulfills most of my needs.

Julia Language of the future

The life goes by...
